events.comment:
The terrain cells are linked to their neighbors to allow to find paths and evaluate the distances between houses and wells or markets.

2 instances of the same object can't be linked together so 2 objects are used:
- SquareContent, linked to its neighbors SquareContentLink
- SquareContentLink, linked to its neighbors SquareContent

The SquareContentLinks and SquareContents that superpose are not linked to one another because it would mess with the distance (in node count or node weight).
There are actually 2 independent link networks. The LinkedSquareContent group contains both SquareContent and SquareContentLink to use the complete network.

The Link prefix and Linked suffix are also use on House, Road, Well and Market and follow the same logic.
As every SquareContent is linked to its neighbors SquareContentLink and link work both ways, SquareContentLink are linked to its neighbors SquareContent too.
There is a help page for this extension. It can be found by double clicking the action and clicking on "Help for this action".
To be able to change the same square twice in a row
The variable cursorOnTools avoid to brush the map when the user selects a palette item.
Modify the map only if the cursor is on a new square to avoid to update the map continuously
Wipe the square before adding a new content in it

Add the new content
In the case of the eraser nothing takes the place of the old content
Link it to the map
The map has change, the distances need to be calculated again.

Text with a value will be shown back.
This is a lot more performant that resetting the text to an empty string because the text is rendered only when it changes.
Indeed:
- hide, replace "3" by "3", show back = no text rendering
- replace "3" by "" and then "3" again = text rendering
People need their house to be next to a road or next to another house that is next to a road.

People need to reach a well through a road shorter than 12 squares (and may go through one of their neighbors)

The distance is evaluated with 2 steps:
- first only the roads are traveled
- then houses can be traveled

This is not the same as searching a path with a group of Road and House
because then the path could take shortcuts going through house in the middle of the path.
The zigzag next to the well illustrate this.
The weel distance is used for this 2nd calculus step.

(exactly the same as for wells)
People need to reach a market through a road shorter than 12 squares (and may go through one of their neighbors)
The links are used in "UpdateDistances" to set the text for the right SquareContent.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @ddabrahim
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: An action to move the camera by **dragging** with the mouse (or **scrolling** with the touch), on vertical, horizontal or both directions.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DragCameraWithPointer
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: An action to move the camera by dragging with the mouse (or scrolling with the touch), on vertical, horizontal or both directions.

eventsFunctions.description: Drag camera with the pointer
eventsFunctions.name: DragCameraWithPointer
eventsFunctions.sentence: Drag camera _PARAM1_ on layer _PARAM2_ in _PARAM3_ direction with the pointer

events.comment: when mouse button is pressed, get start position of mouse
get direction selected
when mouse button is pressed, get current position of mouse and calculate distance between the previous and current position on X and Y axis
if selected direction is horizontal or both
when mouse button is pressed, move camera on X axis
if direction is vertical or both
when mouse button is pressed, move camera on Y axis

parameters.description: Direction you want to drag the camera. It can be "vertical" or  "horizontal" or "both"
parameters.name: Direction

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This provides:
* "Can reach through links" conditions, useful to check if an object is linked to another through one or more other linked objects.
* a path finding movement behavior that uses objects links (instead of obstacles for the other behavior)

For instance, it can be helpful for grid-based games like:
* Match-3 (see BimBam example)
* Tactical (see Tactical example)
* City builders (see City Builder example)
* Point and click (bypass obstacles with a predetermined polygonal chain)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LinkTools
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Conditions to use Linked Objects as a graph and a path finding movement behavior
